intro: Conyza montevidensis, commonly known as the Southernweed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in disturbed areas and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. Its small yellow flowers are arranged in a composite head, and it produces seeds that are dispersed by wind. Conyza montevidensis is often considered a weed but has some ecological and potential medicinal significance.
